body: Not that I can see. The `-vvv` logs doesn't show anything when I select, and with events shown there's so much output I can't distinguish what's going on. I'll try to filter that out.

The alt tabbing sounds strange to me. If the clipboard thread crashed, I would understand, but if it recovers that sounds like everything should be working fine.

Does copying to the clipboard work, not the primary selection buffer? If so that should mean that Alacritty is still able to communicate properly with Wayland. If that works just fine, I'd honestly try to test with a different compositor since GNOME is usually a bit suspect.

happens to me as well. 
100% reproducible.

I can provide any logs, just tell me what is needed.

```
$ alacritty --version
alacritty 0.7.1 (a852eb85)

$ uname -a
Linux workd 5.10.10-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat, 23 Jan 2021 23:59:48 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ gnome-shell --version
GNOME Shell 3.38.3

$ env | grep XDG
XDG_MENU_PREFIX=gnome-
XDG_SESSION_DESKTOP=gnome
XDG_SESSION_TYPE=wayland
XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP=GNOME
XDG_SESSION_CLASS=user
XDG_RUNTIME_DIR=/run/user/1000
```

Small screen cast showing the problem: https://gofile.io/d/L5J7N0

----
PS
`alacritty -vvv` simply does not emit any new log entries when selecting text

Note that I wasn't facing that issue when I wasn't on Wayland. Otherwise, that's the exact same thing as @axxapy. Tried grepping on the output of `alacritty --print-events` but I quite don't know what I'm looking for to be honest.

> Does copying to the clipboard work, not the primary selection buffer? If so that should mean that Alacritty is still able to communicate properly with Wayland. If that works just fine, I'd honestly try to test with a different compositor since GNOME is usually a bit suspect.

Copy/Paste (Ctrl+Shift+C/Ctrl+Shift+V): same issue

On Sway I get nothing of the sort, but I can reproduce this on Weston (for the clipboard only, seeing as how they don't even implement the primary selection). 
[Here's the full wayland log when it happens](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/files/5890994/wl-log.txt) if that is more useful.

I don't see any errors/warnings or any mention of clipboard or selection running as:

```bash
$ script -fec 'alacritty -vvv --print-events -o debug.log_level=Trace'
```

Just `alacritty -vvv | grep "clipboard"` should be sufficient. Though that would mean that the clipboard thinks it is operating smoothly, which kinda makes me suspect that it might be a compositor problem.

Maybe @vberger knows what's going on?

> Just `alacritty -vvv | grep "clipboard"` should be sufficient.

This produces no output.

> which kinda makes me suspect that it might be a compositor problem.

Maybe, but other applications (firefox, konsole, gnome-terminal, thunderbird) don't seem to encounter this problem.

@chrisduerr Indeed. Grepping through logs for the relevant wayland events while repeatedly copying random text without changing focus, one sees from alacritty a pattern like
```
[3126281.805]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@60)
[3126281.836]  -> wl_data_source@60.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3126281.859]  -> wl_data_source@60.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3126281.882]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@60, 3032)
[3128652.321]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@32)
[3128652.353]  -> wl_data_source@32.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3128652.375]  -> wl_data_source@32.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3128652.398]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@32, 3032)
[3130578.007]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@58)
[3130578.039]  -> wl_data_source@58.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3130578.060]  -> wl_data_source@58.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3130578.084]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@58, 3032)
[3133951.679]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@59)
[3133951.742]  -> wl_data_source@59.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3133951.770]  -> wl_data_source@59.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3133951.795]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@59, 3032)
[3135535.431]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@56)
[3135535.463]  -> wl_data_source@56.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3135535.486]  -> wl_data_source@56.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3135535.510]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@56, 3032)
[3137102.011]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@51)
[3137102.042]  -> wl_data_source@51.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3137102.064]  -> wl_data_source@51.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3137102.088]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@51, 3032)
[3138700.244]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@57)
[3138700.275]  -> wl_data_source@57.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3138700.297]  -> wl_data_source@57.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3138700.321]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@57, 3032)
[3140219.220]  -> wl_data_device_manager@42.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@43)
[3140219.250]  -> wl_data_source@43.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3140219.272]  -> wl_data_source@43.offer("UTF8_STRING")
[3140219.296]  -> wl_data_device@49.set_selection(wl_data_source@43, 3032)
```
and so on, whereas with weston-terminal (which is functioning as one expects) there is 
```
3022002.486] wl_data_device@12.data_offer(new id wl_data_offer@28959000)
[3022002.519] wl_data_offer@4278190081.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3022002.540] wl_data_device@12.selection(wl_data_offer@4278190081)
[3022002.560]  -> wl_data_offer@4278190080.destroy()
[3022002.576] wl_data_source@25.send("text/plain;charset=utf-8", fd 8)
[3026536.804]  -> wl_data_device_manager@9.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@27)
[3026536.834]  -> wl_data_source@27.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3026536.857]  -> wl_data_device@12.set_selection(wl_data_source@27, 2872)
[3026537.008] wl_data_source@25.cancelled()
[3026537.032]  -> wl_data_source@25.destroy()
[3026537.050] wl_data_device@12.data_offer(new id wl_data_offer@28846456)
[3026537.077] wl_data_offer@4278190080.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3026537.099] wl_data_device@12.selection(wl_data_offer@4278190080)
[3026537.121]  -> wl_data_offer@4278190081.destroy()
[3026537.139] wl_data_source@27.send("text/plain;charset=utf-8", fd 8)
[3028467.588]  -> wl_data_device_manager@9.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@25)
[3028467.619]  -> wl_data_source@25.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3028467.641]  -> wl_data_device@12.set_selection(wl_data_source@25, 2881)
[3028467.809] wl_data_source@27.cancelled()
[3028467.832]  -> wl_data_source@27.destroy()
[3028467.849] wl_data_device@12.data_offer(new id wl_data_offer@29271912)
[3028467.875] wl_data_offer@4278190081.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3028467.895] wl_data_device@12.selection(wl_data_offer@4278190081)
[3028467.915]  -> wl_data_offer@4278190080.destroy()
[3028467.931] wl_data_source@25.send("text/plain;charset=utf-8", fd 8)
[3031082.332]  -> wl_data_device_manager@9.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@27)
[3031082.363]  -> wl_data_source@27.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3031082.385]  -> wl_data_device@12.set_selection(wl_data_source@27, 2890)
[3031082.536] wl_data_source@25.cancelled()
[3031082.558]  -> wl_data_source@25.destroy()
[3031082.575] wl_data_device@12.data_offer(new id wl_data_offer@29313056)
[3031082.601] wl_data_offer@4278190080.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3031082.621] wl_data_device@12.selection(wl_data_offer@4278190080)
[3031082.641]  -> wl_data_offer@4278190081.destroy()
[3031082.656] wl_data_source@27.send("text/plain;charset=utf-8", fd 8)
[3090153.663]  -> wl_data_device_manager@9.create_data_source(new id wl_data_source@25)
[3090153.692]  -> wl_data_source@25.offer("text/plain;charset=utf-8")
[3090153.715]  -> wl_data_device@12.set_selection(wl_data_source@25, 2899)
[3090153.873] wl_data_source@27.cancelled()
[3090153.896]  -> wl_data_source@27.destroy()
```
At a glance I would guess the proximate cause is the absence of the `wl_data_source.cancelled()`, with the effect that the old `wl_data_source` -- still entirely valid so far as the protocol is concerned -- is being used, no matter how many new ones are successfuly created and offered to the compositor. Once another client sets the selection the cycle is broken as `cancelled()` is finally received. 

If the `WAYLAND_DEBUG` logs under GNOME show the same thing it would be unlikely to be a compositor bug, but even if it isn't I would strongly suspect that it's not really alacritty proper that is at fault but one in the chain of dependencies that are actually speaking Wayland to the compositor.

It looks like a regression. It works for me if I build alacritty 0.6.0 (04cbf76).

A manual bisect shows the failure was introduced on this commit:

- https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/commit/116faba7c607f1b2cb56c390d44b33a52603f642

So it looks like an issue with the https://github.com/Smithay/smithay-clipboard crate.

issue.title: Clipboard updates only once

repository.name: smithay-clipboard
repository.description: Provides access to the wayland clipboard for client applications

issue.body:
This was reported to Alacritty in https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/4735.

It seems like the clipboard has an issue where it only updates its content once on some compositors (GNOME/weston) and requires users to switch applications before they can write to the clipboard again.

@r-c-f has provided a very helpful Wayland log, which suggests the problem might be with smithay-clipboard not cancelling the data source for the clipboard data: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/4735#issuecomment-769735431

According to @jamesodhunt this regression was introduced in https://github.com/Smithay/smithay-clipboard/commit/f6f5b98235b1a5052aff1fb5a48e7951720beb42: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/4735#issuecomment-769737024

body: I've reported the issue upstream in https://github.com/Smithay/smithay-clipboard/issues/33. If anyone has additional information, I'd recommend posting it there.

I can confirm that currently working workaround is to downgrade alacritty to 0.6.0
Tested on gnome 3.38.3 (arch linux, kernel 5.10.11)
